results.title: The Teaching triad (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jerry Maybrook, Lane Wipff, Susan Rafin, AIMS Instructional Media and Dubnoff Center
results.brief_description: Focuses on the direct involvement of the educational therapist with the family of the handicapped child as well as the child himself. Defines the teacher parent child component as the teaching triad and demonstrates ways teachers and parents together can help to bring the child to his optimal level of development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Maybrook, Lane Wipff, Susan Rafin, AIMS Instructional Media and Dubnoff Center

results.title: Teaching the way they learn: remediation of learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Learning Series”.
Dr. Sam Rabinovitch explains some of the methods used in teaching children with learning disabilities due to poor listening ability or poor bodily coordination. Points out how important it is that the child learns and understands what is being taught

results.title: Teaching teenagers about alcohol
results.brief_description: Shows to teachers the best methods of teaching teenagers about alcohol. Uses a summer seminar for teachers as a setting to describe one teacher’s highly successful approach to the problem.

results.title: Teaching
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”
A vocational guidance film. Shows some of the variety of teaching situations in Australian schools and discusses the opportunities in the profession.

results.title: Tea from Nyasaland
results.brief_description: A complete story of the growth, cultivation, and preparation of tea. The plantation sequences, shot in Nyasaland, East Equatorial Africa, show how the tea plant is grown and cultivated, how the leaves of the tea plant are picked, fermented, dried, cut and packed for bulk shipment. The London sequences show how the bulk tea is received, sampled, blended, and packed for retail to the consumer.
results.description: A complete story of the growth, cultivation, and preparation of tea. The plantation sequences, shot in Nyasaland, East Equatorial Africa, show how the tea plant is grown and cultivated, how the leaves of the tea plant are picked, fermented, dried, cut and packed for bulk shipment. The London sequences show how the bulk tea is received, sampled, blended, and packed for retail to the consumer.

results.title: A Taste of energy
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Colonial Sugar Industry and Scope Films
results.brief_description: The Australian sugar industry, showing all stages of cane cultivation and harvesting, extraction and refining of sugar. Impressions of life in the sugar producing regions of Queensland and northern New South Wales and the place of sugar in the Australian economy.

results.title: Tasmania's holiday highlands
results.creator_credit: Brian Merrett and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: In the heart of Tasmania’s scenic highlands, a wealth of hydro-electric power is produced through twelve dams and power stations linked by rivers, canals, pipelines and tunnels. These beautiful natural and man-made lakes attract tourists of all kinds, especially hikers and salmon fishermen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Merrett and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production

results.title: Target for tonight
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of a bombing raid by Britain’s Royal Air Force on a German base in 1941. Covers the preliminary planning beginning with aerial photographic reconnaissance of the objective, preparations and the attack itself.

results.title: Taram: a Minangkabau Village
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Keith Gow, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
In the Indonesian village of Taram, Sumatra, the clan inheritance is passed from mother to daughter - a matrilineal society. The husband is considered a guest in his wife’s house. This film centres around a man of high rank in the village. It shows the daily occupations of the villagers, and a ceremony in which the hereditary clan leaders are raised

results.title: Taming the Sutlej
results.creator_credit: Ravi Prakash, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The Bhakra-Nangal Project designed to provide a year-round supply of water for irrigation and hydro-electric power for homes and industry, consists of two dams across the Sutlej, one at Bhakra, the other at Nangal. This film records the work done by men and machines in an effort to complete the job before the specified date.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ravi Prakash, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
